FuncDef:
The nat alarm no-pat address-group threshold command sets the upper and lower thresholds for no-PAT address pool usage.
The undo nat alarm no-pat address-group threshold command restores the default alarm thresholds for no-PAT address pool usage.
By default, the upper alarm threshold is 80%, and the lower alarm threshold is 70%.
CLIs: undo nat alarm no-pat address-group threshold [ <threshold-value> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an alarm threshold for No-PAT address pools.
The value is an integer ranging from 60 to 100, in percentage. The default value is 80.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To set the alarm threshold for No-PAT address pools, run the nat alarm No-pat address-group threshold command. The command helps monitor No-PAT address pool usage in each NAT instance. If No-PAT address pool usage reaches a specified threshold, an alarm is sent to the NMS. When the IP address usage falls below 87.5% of the preset threshold, the system generates a clear alarm.
Precautions
This command is applicable only to the NAT address pool in non-easy IP mode.
